text.title: Be a Normal Teenage Girl
text.head: Be a Normal Teenage Girl
text.p: Help on just how to look and act to achieve the coveted status of 'normal'.
text.head: Steps

list.item: Change hairstyles if your hair is long enough. It is always good to experiment with your own styles. Pluck your eyebrows if you wish.
Keep your make-up modest and matching. Wearing red whilst having pink and blue make-up on, and too much of it, will not give people the right impression on you.
Make sure you have enough clothing. Look at what clothes you need and buy that. Do not buy loads of jeans when you really need a new coat.
Do the same for shoes and accessories. Have different shoes, clothes and accessories for every different occasion.
Have good manners and confidence. Being rude, disrespectful and shy is not going to make people like you. Instead, try to be a polite, kind, confident person.
Watch your language. Do not swear too much and be mindful who you swear around. Also, having a wide range of vocabulary can be very useful.
Be humorous, not offensive. Many people enjoy being around somebody who'll make them laugh, but don't offend people.
Talk often, but not too much. Don't be shy to say your opinion but don't butt in and interrupt everything. Let everyone speak.
Be cool, calm and collected. Getting annoyed or angry at everything won't help anybody.
Have good self esteem and believe in yourself.
Do not copy others. Copying others work or style does not help you in any way later in life.
Respect others, but do as you would be done by. So give people respect, but if for example they ignore you, ignore them. They may need to know what it feels like.
Have lots of friends. Trust them and spend time with them. Express your annoyance towards them if you have any, so you don't end up bursting into a full fire rage at them.
Love your family, and show it. Hug, kiss and compliment your family to make them feel appreciated, loved and respected.
Whatever happens, don't hold grudges forever. People are always making mistakes, and friendships and family is a million times more important than one silly mistake.
Behave well at school. Do your homework, have all necessary equipment and have a fun day.
Join clubs. Don't be afraid to join the football team, or learn Italian in lunchtimes etc.!
Respect your bedroom. Keep it clean, nice and well decorated.
Look after and care for your possessions. Don't get a new phone and ask for a different one a month later.
Eat well. Drink lots of water and keep a balanced diet.
Clean yourself thoroughly, daily. Wash your hair as often as needed and brush your teeth at least twice a day.
Get enough sleep. Websites will inform you how much sleep you need for your age.
Enjoy life. Play games, watch TV, and have fun!
